result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R. Sittig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To run concurrent with current prison term in 15CF57.  0 days credit.  Defendant is statutorily eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 15CF57

superMiscConds.notes: JOC AMENDED 7/26/17: Judge Andrew Sharp waives all costs in 15CF98. DOC to make note that there are no longer any court costs associated with this case.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  No contact with CB. Submit DNA sample. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling, education or treatment.  Domestic abuse treatment, 24-26 week class. Maintain absolute sobriety. Criminal thinking/cognitive behavioral class. Pay costs.
Concurrent with: 15CF57

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony R. Sittig
Current: JCI, 404377, PO Box 233, Black River Falls, WI 54615-0233 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2017)
Prior: Jackson Correctional Inst.    #404377, PO Box 233, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

15CF109 and 15CF98/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court, in custody of DOC, with attorney Andrew I. Martinez. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  PSI noted.  Counsel and Def address the Court.  

Court believes joint recommendation is appropriate and sentences def as follows:

15CF98 - count 3/strangulation - 2 years prison and 2 years ext. supervision to run concurrent with prison term in 15CF57

15CF109 - count 1/battery or threat to law enf. officer - 2 years prison and 2 years ext. supervision to run concurrent with current prison term in 15CF57 and now also with 15CF98
count 2/bail jumping - same sentence, concurrent
count 3/bail jumping - same sentence, concurrent

Conditions of ES:  No contact with CB; submit DNA sample; attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling, education or treatment, d.a. treatment, 24-26 week class; maintain absolute sobriety; criminal thinking class/cognitive behavioral class.

Statutorily eligible for Challenge Incarceration.  Statutorily eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

1 set of costs, imposed in the strangulation case 15CF98; waived in the other case.

proposed Order to Produce
Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew I. Martinez. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for status:  15CF98, 15CF100, 15CF109, 15CF110, 16CF36, and 16CF37.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for plea:  Def to plead to Count 3/strangulation in 15CF98 and Count 1/battery and Counts 2 and 3/felony bail jumping in 15CF109; remaining counts and cases to be dismissed and read in; asking for PSI order.

Def pleads no contest to the charges stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered; author to be present at sentencing.  Court sets sentencing for 3/17 at 2:30.  PSI due by 3/3.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
TO TRANSPORT
Status conference on January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew I. Martinez appeared by phone means for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig who is in prison. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together. Counsel jointly ask for a reset, stating they are working towards resolution. Atty. M asks that def be produced for next hrg. Court directs DA's office to produce order to transport.  Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Martinez asking for phone appearance and making sure transport is not needed

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony R. Sittig not in court; presently in WI prison system.  Several cases called together.  Counsel request setover of the status.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  15CF110, 16CF37, 15CF57, 16CF36, 15CF57, 15CF109, 15CF98, and 15CF100.  Def waives prelim rights in all matters except for 15CF57 as that is a sentencing after rev case and needs to be set for a hearing.  Court accepts prelim waiver and conducts waiver colloquy.  State files informations.  Formal readings waived in each case.  Court states the charges.  Def pleads not guilty to all felonies and also to the misdemeanors in these cases.  DA asks for sentencing date in 15CF57 to address sentencing after rev and sentencing after revocation of DPA; asks for this to be yet in May; doesn't think other cases will be ready for dispo at that time.  Court sets 15CF57 for 2:30 5/13.  All other matters set for 6/22 at 10 - status.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig.  3 cases called together:
15CF100/initial, 15CF98/adjourned initial,, and 15CF57/motion hearing.

12/16 at 1:30 for adjourned initial in 15CF100, status in both 15CF98 and 15CF57.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-16-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received a copy of the complaint but has not had a chance to review it with her client. Atty M. requests modification of bond re. no contact provision. Victim addresses the Court. DA objects. Comment by Atty M. Court denies request for modification of bond conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
